item.title: Marvel Rivals 6.5 Roadmap Details New Events and Costumes
item.content:encoded:
The full Marvel Rivals season 6.5 roadmap has been revealed.

Marvel Rivals season 6.5 is getting ready to launch on February 13. It was previously announced that Elsa Bloodstone would be joining the cast as a new hero. However, the full roadmap has now been released, featuring new events, plenty of costumes, and more.

The rest of the season runs through the start of season 7 on March 20. This will be a collection of highlights from the upcoming roadmap.

New Events Coming to Marvel Rivals in Season 6.5

On February 13, I knew the event would launch surrounding the wedding of Rogue and Gambit. There will also be another event surrounding the monster Kingdom and Deadpool‚Äôs rise as the new Monster King.

February 20 sees the start of the new Monster Kingdom Championship Tournament. That is a Deadpool-hosted tournament, previously announced alongside the season 6.5 full balance notes. There‚Äôs also the start of the Twisted Nightmare and Faulty Dream events.

New Costumes Aplenty

In Season 6.5, there are plenty of costume drops. Captain America and Moon Night will have new costumes related to the Twisted Nightmare event. There are also new costumes for Psylocke and The Thing, among others.

Learn more about Elsa Bloodstone joining the roster here.

NetEase, the developer of Marvel Rivals, recently reported strong financial results. Some of that success was attributed to the implementation of AI. Read more here.

How are you feeling about the Marvel Rivals Season 6.5 Roadmap? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don‚Äôt forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Fortnite x Overwatch Crossover Brings Genji, Tracer, D.Va
item.content:encoded:
The Overwatch x Fortnite content has been revealed by a popular leaker.

Fortnite creator Shiina recently shared more news about the collaboration. In a brief YouTube video and on Twitter, they announced that Genji, Mercy, Tracer, and D.Va would be added to the game as skins.

News of the collaboration first dropped back in late January.

More Collaborations Are on Their Way to Fortnite

Shiina also shared on social media that a Lego collaboration was on the way. A new LEGO Pass is slated to drop on April 16.

In other Fortnite news, it‚Äôs been reported that jam tracks, including Eminem‚Äôs ‚ÄúThe Real Slim Shady,‚Äù ‚ÄúFE!N‚Äù by Travis Scott, and ‚ÄúBye Bye Bye,‚Äù have been potentially scrapped.

Overwatch Is Experiencing a Resurgence

Recently, Overwatch announced a major overhaul, returning to its original name and launching a new story arc that will run through 2026. Learn more about ‚ÄúThe Reign of Talon‚Äù at this link.

This move has led to success for the hero shooter, as the game reached an all-time high player count on February 11. Learn more about that here.

Insider Gaming continues to keep track of all of the crossovers coming to Fortnite

Are you excited about the world of Overwatch coming to Fortnite? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don‚Äôt forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
